questions.text: What was the opening shot of the episode?
options: In the motorcycle shop Dan owned
questions.explanation:
In the Connors' living room.

	The first few seconds showed the iconic living room with Roseanne yelling Dan's name. Then it panned to their bedroom where Dan woke up with a breathing mask on. The joke in the scene was that Roseanne thought Dan was dead, as he had been killed off in the original show's final season. That was retconned with a joke about how everyone is always thinking he's dead.

questions.text: Which of the Connor children moved back into the house?
questions.explanation:
Darlene.

	Darlene and her children had moved back in a few weeks before the episode. Becky and D.J. were also on the show while youngest son Jerry Garcia Connor was "away" and not in the episode. He was apparently on a fishing boat where there was no phone service. Dan was upset that he couldn't make his coffee in the nude since the family moved back in.  Darlene was played by Sarah Gilbert.

Roseanne.

	Roseanne was eating a marshmallow Peep for breakfast when Darlene walked into the kitchen. Darlene asked her if she had checked her blood sugar and Dan outed her that she hadn't. Roseanne claimed that it was fine.  Darlene had quit her job and moved home to take care of her mother's health. It was later revealed that Darlene has also lost her job, and moved home with her two kids - she was just too embarrassed to admit it.

questions.text: Roseanne and her sister Jackie were fighting over politics.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Jackie had intended to vote for Hillary Clinton (despite actually voting for Jill Stein). Roseanne thought that was a bad enough decision that they were feuding.  Jackie's first line was "What's up deplorable" and she was wearing a shirt that said "Nasty woman", both callbacks to the 2016 U.S. presidential election.  Their feud continued for the entire scene with Roseanne playing the conservative role. In the real world Roseanne Barr was a major supporter of Donald Trump.

questions.text: Sarah Chalke played oldest daughter Becky in the later seasons of the original show. She was brought back to play another character in this show. What was the  new character's name?
questions.explanation:
Andrea.

	Andrea was a woman who hired the Becky to be a surrogate to have a baby for her. She was going to be paid several thousand dollars to use one of her own eggs and Andrea's husband's sperm to produce the baby. Chalke played a doctor on the show "Scrubs" for nearly a decade after the original "Roseanne" ended.  For this show Lecy Goranson returned to the role. She was the original actress to play the character.

questions.text: Mark was revealed to have PTSD after serving in the military.
questions.explanation:
False.

	D.J. was 3 months out of the service, with his wife still serving. There was no mention of PTSD though. D.J. was played by Michael Fishman. Mark (From the original series) was not in either episode this quiz covers.

questions.text: Which Connor grandchild was a crossdresser?
questions.explanation:
Mark.

	Mark Healy was the son of Darlene and David. Mark was named after his uncle who had died off screen during the 20 years between the end of the first series and this new one. Mark Healy was played by Ames McNamara.  The original actor for Mark couldn't return to the show because Glenn Quinn died of a drug overdose in 2002.

Dan.

	Dan (played by John Goodman) gave his grandson a pocket knife. Mark then took the knife to school. Darlene was upset about it, but Dan argued that he had given her a knife at the same age. Darlene was called to the school after Mark pulled the knife out during the day.

questions.text: Jackie was no longer a police officer, having retired during the initial run of the show. What was she doing to make a living during this episode?
questions.explanation:
Life coach.

	Jackie Harris, played by Laurie Metcalf, had went back to school and become a certified life coach. She bragged about her degree several times during the show. Roseanne and a few others had a less than favorable outlook of Jackie's new career, even if she never voiced it out loud, it was noticeable in the body language.

questions.text: What sport did Dan play with Darlene and Mark?
questions.explanation:
Basketball.

	In the final scene of the show Dan and Mark were playing basketball when Darlene joined in. The scene was short, in the driveway. The driveway was shown to have some piles of trash and furniture in it.
